Expectation1: Attending children's school events and activities
Situation1: An open class is scheduled at the school, and the parent should attend
Expectation2: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation2: A notice has been posted about an optional training session happening next week.
Story: I stared at the crumpled flyer in my hand, the one my daughter had pressed into my palm this morning, her eyes shining with hope. “Open class is next week, Daddy. Can you come?” she’d asked, her voice small but expectant. I promised I’d try, but as I walked onto the construction site, the foreman’s new notice caught my eye: an optional training session, same day, same time. “It’s not mandatory,” he said, “but it’ll look good for anyone hoping for more hours.” I felt the weight of my hard hat grow heavier. My team counted on me to show commitment, to be there, to pull my weight. But my little girl counted on me too, to show up, to be present, to prove she mattered more than bricks and mortar. My mind spun with the pressure—if I missed the training, would I lose out on extra shifts? If I missed the open class, would I see disappointment in her eyes? The two worlds pulled at me, each demanding more than I felt I had to give.
